modules.description: The module provides functions for defining text formatting styles, including color customization (foreground/background) and effects like bold or underlined, along with structured prompt configurations for interactive CLI elements. It operates on style configurations and color representations to tailor terminal output, enabling use cases such as enhancing readability in prompts, differentiating error messages, and styling options in question-based interfaces.

Provides functions to display prompts and collect binary responses ("y" or "n") or select from a list of options. Works with strings, characters, and lists to manage user input in terminal environments. Enables interactive configuration setup and decision-making during command-line execution.

This module provides low-level terminal control operations, including cursor manipulation, screen clearing, scrolling, and text styling with ANSI escape codes, alongside functions for managing terminal size and behavior. It works with types representing colors, text styles, and cursor positions, enabling precise customization of terminal output. Use cases include building interactive command-line interfaces, terminal-based applications, or colored logging systems where terminal formatting and control are required.

provides tools to define and apply text styles and structured prompts for interactive CLIs, using color and effect configurations to enhance visual clarity. It supports operations on style definitions, color codes, and prompt layouts to customize terminal output. Users can create styled prompts, highlight errors, and format choices in question interfaces. Examples include rendering bold red error messages or underlined options in a menu.
